94E6576FCD044E9B9EB0F22E190902F2.description: SSCN.G.37: identify which option would appear to be an optimally effective choice in each case

019DD6C6EE434215B806974F5BE1530E.description: SSCN.G.36: analyze policy options proposed for each global issue

95B614173E034A6A925EFB4795EEDB30.description: SSCN.G.35: examine and evaluate several significant global issues confronting the modern world, such as the War on Terror, radical terrorism, wealth disparity, and human rights violations

E5FA74EDADE64E578BE67F4A4CCE6C66.description: SSCN.F.34: identify current issues relevant to Constitutional rights and their interpretation

9CCD7F7D5B9D46BABC0586AA3083C3C2.description: SSCN.F.33: explain why rights guaranteed in the Constitution are relative and are not absolute

F64CB95AB11147C582D3C166CB84B884.description: SSCN.F.32: examine arguments for and against several volatile constitutional issues in the United States, including Second Amendment rights and limits on First Amendment rights

EFB28DC7EAA84B22939FE682949FA9F7.description: SSCN.E.31: evaluate whether unjust discrimination harms all Americans or just those who are its target

5D3EAC774FA14EF392BD5B66FD46D599.description: SSCN.E.30: examine and evaluate the government's attempts to deal with invidious discrimination, including policies related to Title IX and affirmative action

A1AE28F9031E4A0BA17C3264CA45F5C2.description: SSCN.E.29: analyze current discrimination issues in the United States

6510A0F809084AE1B6EB7819F4D43EA3.description: SSCN.D.28: identify Life and Health issues currently facing today's society such as obesity, use of GMOs, and Roe v. Wade

78A836AF46DD4646977174EB2F149DB0.description: SSCN.D.27: formulate possible solutions based on an informed perspective rather than an emotional reaction to the issues

2F021B6E5DAF45A89AB32AF2A92C3DEA.description: SSCN.D.26: evaluate the increasing economic demand on community agencies and resources relating to federal programs such as Medicare, Medicaid, and the Affordable Care Act

293A1AE243394B47B41F3995AF5174F0.description: SSCN.D.25: analyze and evaluate major life and health issues facing today's society

860B1E93528F423DA18AB37E04631B8F.description: SSCN.C.24: examine the basic principles of constructive discourse in order to engage in rational, thoughtful discussions on public policy issues

5025681CC4FC4B438D925597580456CC.description: SSCN.C.23: analyze the most common fallacies of ordinary reasoning in order to evaluate the validity, clarity, and precision of types of arguments, such as Ad Populum, Ad Hominem, and Slippery Slope

961B86A4B5A143199991241B55D5D02E.description: SSCN.C: World Views, Logical Fallacies, and Constructive Discourse

046681F7CFB74B45B0A8DD6EECE95CF9.description: SSCN.B.22.a: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by introducing a topic and organizing complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a unified whole; including formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension

0FAEF2BC14A84327B45F106733616643.description: SSCN.B.21.g: draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research

EAF15A611DE04A62A7FDD560768409CB.description: SSCN.B.21.f: gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the specific task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and overreliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation

D585F10CCA2C49FEB43FCD0EE8FD8209.description: SSCN.B.21.e: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by using precise language, domain-specific vocabulary and techniques such as metaphor, simile, and analogy to manage the complexity of the topic; conveying a knowledgeable stance in a style that responds to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers

06D9C5EC34774318A92ABEB0623D42DB.description: SSCN.B.21.d: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by using varied transitions and sentence structures to link the major sections of the text, creating cohesion, and clarifying the relationships among complex ideas and concepts

54EA7FBED5A04DBF830B256729B7F287.description: SSCN.B.21.c: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by developing the topic thoroughly by selecting the most significant and relevant facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic

1D72248DA26543848439A06E8E786933.description: SSCN.B.21.b: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by introducing a topic and organizing complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a unified whole; including formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension

B7C75600B4C14BF5946F5149DC414CCD.description: SSCN.B.21.a: evaluate authors' differing points of view on the same historical event or issue by assessing the authors' claims, reasoning, and evidence

1306B31940B24E4EB5EED81C500A5AA1.description: SSCN.B.20.n: use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information

FDC196B0DA2548F98D27D04391C6E96E.description: SSCN.B.20.m: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by using precise language, domain-specific vocabulary and techniques such as metaphor, simile, and analogy to manage the complexity of the topic; conveying a knowledgeable stance in a style that responds to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers

1C8F6E8DBD414F0BBF2AA2D0FD839D31.description: SSCN.B.20.l: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by using varied transitions and sentence structures to link the major sections of the text, creating cohesion, and clarifying the relationships among complex ideas and concepts

80C8BF22474846B3A1AEC40B4057D5E7.description: SSCN.B.20.k: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by developing the topic thoroughly by selecting the most significant and relevant facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic

C76F226369FA45C1A3D886BA898ECE72.description: SSCN.B.20.j: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by establishing and maintaining a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing

33EBEE1F9CA64828B1C2CFF5B94B8D16.description: SSCN.B.20.i: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by using words, phrases, and clauses as well as varied syntax to link the major sections of the text, creating cohesion, and clarifying the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims

118F3FD060F3476FAC60AFD0240F9E2D.description: SSCN.B.20.h: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by introducing precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establishing the significance of the claim(s), distinguishing the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and creating an organization that logically sequences the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence

8F4AE3B7FAAE4045A18A883021902323.description: SSCN.B.20.g: by the end of grade 12, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 11-12 text complexity band independently and proficiently

1A2DEE16860C42ACB3E9B5F14BB061CC.description: SSCN.B.20.f: integrate information from diverse sources, both primary and secondary, into a coherent understanding of an idea or event, noting discrepancies among sources

1DDB1B6BC7C74251A81B3C05F36210AE.description: SSCN.B.20.e: evaluate an author's premises, claims, and evidence by corroborating or challenging them with other information

3D22715CD5574D8D9B60B22724F5599E.description: SSCN.B.20.d: integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, as well as in words) in order to address a question or solve a problem

89213B405B914C998E1931AED10DF3F2.description: SSCN.B.10.i: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by providing a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented

6CA8FD8E00114A689FC3E2B46505C04D.description: SSCN.B.10.h: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by establishing and maintaining a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing

F12073E3A36B4E8585B0FA870D3F4EC3.description: SSCN.B.10.g: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by using words, phrases, and clauses as well as varied syntax to link the major sections of the text, creating cohesion, and clarifying the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims

9DDD31413CD34F1B95A3A848EF3AD855.description: SSCN.B.10.f: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by developing claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant data and evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate form that anticipates the audience's knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases

33D2B21BF15047E18BBC6B9F62AFBE61.description: SSCN.B.10.e: by the end of grade 12, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 11-12 text complexity band independently and proficiently

D75AAD56093547389167CFA725D981F1.description: SSCN.B.10.d: analyze in detail how a complex primary source is structured, including how key sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text contribute to the whole

86EC81ED08E043BA88904330D459900A.description: SSCN.B.10.c: determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including analyzing how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term over the course of a text

BDC52076EC564F21AAC3D8ADE2D2D38D.description: SSCN.B.10.b: evaluate various explanations for actions or events and determine which explanation best accords with textual evidence, acknowledging where the text leaves matters uncertain

738DA5F6CAB442BC9EA0E11D545B0403.description: SSCN.B.10.a: determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary that makes clear the relationships among the key details and ideas

711E2F32247B41F2921841F89E64D9AD.description: SSCN.B.10: identify main idea, detail, sequence of events, and cause and effect in a social studies context

2102EFCF9ECB423DA61EBF0A28CBC325.description: SSCN.B.9.i: use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information

EB839DAC6CFC413BB3FE730C5FB906C7.description: SSCN.B.9.h: develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience

406083787E864C9DA2F29BF2A223C791.description: SSCN.B.9.g: produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

7F9903385C264EF8B3CC7A32A1B9951C.description: SSCN.B.9.f: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by providing a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation provided (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic)

978665EABEEC46FEA13513FC193426F3.description: SSCN.B.9.e: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by developing claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant data and evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate form that anticipates the audience's knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases

BF19E7A16FF646FAB06C69F7043C4DB6.description: SSCN.B.9.d: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by introducing precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establishing the significance of the claim(s), distinguishing the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and creating an organization that logically sequences the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence

95198C6FA1EB4A13A3DEF5FF4B580657.description: SSCN.B.9.c: integrate information from diverse sources, both primary and secondary, into a coherent understanding of an idea or event, noting discrepancies among sources

323B48F301A6453FBEB0C3722C841D9E.description: SSCN.B.9.b: evaluate an author's premises, claims, and evidence by corroborating or challenging them with other information

E61B8D12E91F4C02B4D3F28FA263FA46.description: SSCN.B.9.a: integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, as well as in words) in order to address a question or solve a problem

BCE233A001B94AB28109DF5C766FA28A.description: SSCN.B.9: distinguish between fact and opinion as used in informational/explanatory text

87194D5FEB27488BA50B4BE4A649DB19.description: SSCN.B.8.f: conduct short as well as more sustained research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation

9DBA8CDD8B4E48A4A39C0A1CD469E06B.description: SSCN.B.8.e: use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information

9C0FF2C4DF56400B9BB6632C3DB30EA4.description: SSCN.B.8.d: develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience

575622651D0348F0A9819C3D07D3B121.description: SSCN.B.8.c: produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

64D37037072C4F7FAB1F57AAEBDF09DB.description: SSCN.B.8.b: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by providing a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation provided (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic)

0BD653B214B3428BB04FFCE58FFA86E8.description: SSCN.B.8.a: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by providing a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented

95DDC1D3C2CE4A0D996345C0AD89535A.description: SSCN.B.8: identify and write about issues and/or problems and alternative solutions

9CA4BD5C22F3442495DC04788086B98C.description: SSCN.B.7.c: develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience

BFB11EEB754944C9A864F469B383758F.description: SSCN.B.7.b: produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

D395A13D1F4F4CB3972A3FAE3BEAE3DE.description: SSCN.B.7.a: cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources, connecting insights gained from specific details to an understanding of the text as a whole

C1EA839237934039BDF021A4AFAAA97C.description: SSCN.B.6.d: conduct short as well as more sustained research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation

BD5219E9ED704175B4CCC307021B920B.description: SSCN.B.6.c: write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events by providing a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation provided (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic)

E5494AF5FEDE4FFE8AC6DD32FF229DCB.description: SSCN.B.6.b: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by developing claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant data and evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate form that anticipates the audience's knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases

243FD67E99B14DDA8B6FAAABA42B9C68.description: SSCN.B.6.a: write arguments focused on discipline-specific content by introducing precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establishing the significance of the claim(s), distinguishing the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and creating an organization that logically sequences the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence

915E33B15FD9413EA7955C275B8DF4C0.description: SSCN.A.5: compare maps with data sets (e.g., charts, tables, graphs) and/or readings to draw conclusions and make generalizations

196363C17697426D87D352CFB003104B.description: SSCN.A.4: compare maps of the same place at different points in time and from different perspectives to determine changes, identify trends, and generalize about human activities

277CC0E6771049EB8A726E12FDBFB364.description: SSCN.A.3: draw conclusions and make generalizations based on information from maps

2F054004E04A4A0FBD75A46F3D422E6B.description: SSCN.A.2: use map key/legend to acquire information from historical, physical, political, resource, product, and economic maps

64B0B04298CE44A9A4F522C6E6D4C829.description: SSCN.A.1: compare and contrast the categories of natural, cultural, and political features found on maps
